Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.personalboard

Class FaithTrack

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.personalboard.FaithTrack
All Implemented Interfaces:
VictoryPointsElement
Direct Known Subclasses:
SinglePlayerFaithTrack
public class FaithTrack
extends java.lang.Object
implements VictoryPointsElement
Class representing a standard Faith Track used in a multi-player match.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init​(java.lang.String nickname, ChangesHandler changesHandler)

    • getFaithMarkerPosition

      public int getFaithMarkerPosition()
      Returns the position of the Faith Marker on the Faith Track. Ranges from 0 to 24.
      Returns:
      position integer.

    • getPopesFavors

      public java.util.List<FavorStatus> getPopesFavors()
      Returns a List of FavorStatus. The elements are sorted in the same fashion as they are displayed on the board, first in the list being the least valuable.
      Returns:
      List of FavorStatus enum elements.

    • getVictoryPoints

      public int getVictoryPoints()
      Returns end-game victory points depending on the position on faith track and on active pope's favors.
      Specified by:
      getVictoryPoints in interface VictoryPointsElement
      Returns:
      number of victory points obtained from the board.

    • moveMarker

      public void moveMarker()
      Moves the Faith Marker up by one position on the Faith Track.

    • checkVaticanReport

      public boolean checkVaticanReport​(int tile)
      If the tile on which the FaithMarker is placed corresponds to a Pope Space and the corresponding Vatican Report has not been called yet, method returns true. Otherwise returns false.
      Returns:
      outcome of the checks on the tile.

    • flipPopesFavor

      public void flipPopesFavor​(int index)
      Handles the logic for turning or discarding a Pope's Favor depending on the Faith Cross' position.
      Parameters:
      index - indicates which of the three Pope's Favors has to be evaluated. If an integer different from 1, 2 or 3 gets passed undefined behavior may occur.
